etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Megapodius (genus name), from mega-‘large’ + Greek pous, pod- ‘foot’

definitions: a large ground-dwelling Australasian and Southeast Asian bird that builds a large mound of debris to incubate its eggs by the heat of decomposition.

notes.text: Family Megapodiidae (the megapode family), which includes the brush turkeys and mallee fowl

shortDefinitions: large ground-dwelling Australasian and SE Asian bird that builds large mound of debris to incubate its eggs by heat of decomposition
